meaningMnemonic:
This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>pickle</kanji>, so the verb version is <vocabulary>to pickle something</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to marinate something</vocabulary>.

漬ける is specifically used to describe the process of pickling or marinating foods, such as vegetables, fish, or meat.
readingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading.  You learned this reading with the kanji. Good for you!
